channel.title: Need Help on code to Auto Login Into RS
channel.description: I need to write a program that would automatically login me into Runescape using Java. If someone can help please post, thx.

item.title: Need Help on code to Auto Login Into RS
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:5, topic:172885”][quote author=VB7 Rocks link=topic=233094.msg1993440#msg1993440 date=1200202939]
Yes, you. We aren’t zombies here to do all of your lazy ass work for you.

We can help you along the way if you need it, but you can’t just ask us to do the entire thing.
[/quote]

He’s asking for help on coding it. Seems sincere.[/quote]

His request was quite vague however. I think he should at least be able to show us that he’s got something to work with, and not just asking for help in general.

“I need help doing ___ in Java”, is what he said, but he failed to provide information on exactly what he needs help with, what part of the program he needs help writing.

I interpreted it as “I need help with all of it and want you guys to do it for me,” sorry if that’s not the case, but if it isn’t, he should re-word his original post.

Read full topic
item.source: Need Help on code to Auto Login Into RS

item.title: Need Help on code to Auto Login Into RS
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“ShadowOfSun, post:3, topic:172885”]Ok I ask this because I program in C# and .NET not Java and I thought this could be a problem someone already has a solution = source ready. If not than I am out of luck.

This is what I need to do or at least I think.

  1. Identify the handle of the applet so I know where to write text
  2. Set my focus to it
  3. Click button “Existing User”
  4. Input needed info = login and password
  5. Click button “Login”

Problem is that I have a program in C# that can write text but it doesn’t work with the Java applet. For example using it on Windows Notepad it writes the text but in the applet it doesn’t seem to do anything or it acts maybe as it didnt have the focus on the applet. I found the handle of the Runescape applet using Spy++ tool in Microsoft Visual Studio 2005. If someone knows what the problem I will be thankfull to hear it. [/quote]

I don’t know much about the .NET languages, but look around on how to search the screen for colors and/or bitmaps. If you can make a system for that then the rest is just manipulating it.

Read full topic
item.source: Need Help on code to Auto Login Into RS

item.title: Need Help on code to Auto Login Into RS
item.dc:creator: @ShadowOfSun ShadowOfSun
item.description:
@ShadowOfSun wrote:

Ok I ask this because I program in C# and .NET not Java and I thought this could be a problem someone already has a solution = source ready. If not than I am out of luck.

This is what I need to do or at least I think.

  1. Identify the handle of the applet so I know where to write text
  2. Set my focus to it
  3. Click button “Existing User”
  4. Input needed info = login and password
  5. Click button “Login”

Problem is that I have a program in C# that can write text but it doesn’t work with the Java applet. For example using it on Windows Notepad it writes the text but in the applet it doesn’t seem to do anything or it acts maybe as it didnt have the focus on the applet. I found the handle of the Runescape applet using Spy++ tool in Microsoft Visual Studio 2005. If someone knows what the problem I will be thankfull to hear it.

Read full topic
